metadata.name: Conduct Universal Search Across Work Apps
metadata.description: Use Dropbox Dash to search for information across all connected work applications (Google Drive, Slack, Notion, email, etc.) from a single interface
prerequisites: Dropbox Dash account with connected applications
At least 3-5 work apps connected (Google Drive, Slack, Notion, etc.)

outputs: Relevant information found across multiple applications
Time saved vs. manual app-by-app searching

steps.description: Open Dropbox Dash search bar via browser extension (Cmd+E or Ctrl+E) or navigate to dash.dropbox.com
steps.output: Dash universal search bar active and ready

steps.description: Type your search query using natural language (e.g., 'Q3 revenue projections', 'customer feedback on new feature', 'meeting notes with John from last week')
tips: Include context clues (timeframe, person names, topics)
Try different phrasings if first attempt doesn't yield results

steps.description: Scan results from all connected applications. Dash displays results grouped by source (Google Drive, Slack, Notion, etc.) with preview snippets
steps.success_criteria: Relevant results found from 2+ different applications

steps.description: If results are overwhelming, filter by specific application (e.g., only show Slack messages or only show Google Docs)
Click on result to preview in Dash or open directly in source application. Use quick actions (share, download) if needed
steps.output: Relevant content accessed without switching apps

steps.description: If results aren't relevant, refine query with more specific terms, date ranges, or people names. Dash learns from your behavior over time
If this is a recurring search topic, save it as a Stack (smart collection) that auto-updates as new content matches
steps.when_to_use: For searches you'll repeat weekly/monthly (e.g., 'customer feedback', 'competitor intel')

quality_checklist: Search query uses natural language (not just keywords)
Results appear from multiple connected applications
Relevant results found within top 10 results
Source attribution clear for each result
Quick actions (open, share, download) work as expected
No need to switch to individual apps to find information
Time saved vs. manual app-by-app search: 60-80%

effective_queries: Include context: 'customer feedback from last month' (not just 'feedback')
Use people names: 'project plan with Sarah' (narrows scope)
Specify timeframe: 'Q3 revenue projections' or 'meeting notes from last week'
Use question format: 'What were the action items from marketing meeting?'
advanced_tips: Dash learns from your click behavior (results improve over time)
Connected apps with more metadata (tags, titles) yield better results
Use Stacks for recurring searches (save query for future use)
Filter by file type if looking for specific format (PDF, spreadsheet, etc.)
Combine with AI Answers for synthesis across sources

time_savings_analysis.without_dash: Manual search across 5 apps: 3-5 minutes per search

common_use_cases: Find email thread from 3 months ago about specific project
Locate presentation deck someone shared in Slack last week
Search for all documents related to upcoming product launch
Find meeting notes with specific stakeholder from last quarter
Discover internal research on competitor analysis
Locate customer feedback across email, Slack, and support tickets
Find policy document mentioned in team meeting

troubleshooting.no_results_found: Check app connections in Dash settings; verify you have access to content in source app; try broader search terms
troubleshooting.irrelevant_results: Add more context to query (names, dates, topics); use filters; refine based on what's appearing
troubleshooting.missing_app_results: Ensure app is connected in Dash settings; check OAuth permissions; verify content sync is complete
troubleshooting.slow_search: Check internet connection; some apps may have sync delay (1-5 minutes); try again shortly
